associationsubgraphs 0.1.0

Find all subgraphs in pairs for every subset of edges

Source: R/subgraphs_functions.R
find_all_subgraphs.Rd

Given a dataframe of edges with strength between nodes this function returns info on every subgraph state achieved by adding nodes in one-at-a-time in descending order of strength.

find_all_subgraphs(association_pairs)

Arguments

association_pairs

dataframe with columns a and b representing the ids of the variables or nodes and columns strength that is a numeric indicator of strength of association (higher = stronger).

Value

Dataframe with the following columns for each unique subgraph state.

cutoff

The lowest of the edge(s) added to achieve network state

subgraphs

List column of dataframes that contains each node residing in a subgraph at this state and that subgraphs id.

step

Integer step, aka the number of unique edge strengths in network at state

largest_size

Size in number of nodes of the largest current subgraph

smallest_size

Size of the smallest current subgraph

avg_size

Average size of subgraphs

n

Total number of subgraphs

n_mergers

Number of subgraphs with more than two nodes that were merged in the last step

total_merger_magnitude

Sum of sizes of all merged subgraphs

Examples

virus_net %>%
  dplyr::arrange(dplyr::desc(strength)) %>%
    head(1000) %>%
    find_all_subgraphs()
#> Error: '' does not exist in current working directory ('/Users/nick/R_code/associationsubgraphs/docs/reference').
